cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 435 miles SE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, slowing as it approaches the South Carolina coast, then expected to drift inland across SC/GA before turning northeast along the Atlantic seaboard
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South Carolina between the Savannah River and Little River Inlet (near/just north of Charleston)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Savannah River GA to Little River Inlet SC (Tropical Storm Watch area shown on advisory map)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River to Little River Inlet, South Carolina (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Georgia, South Carolina and southeastern North Carolina Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely at Tampa; highest 5-day probability only 3% at nearby Cedar Key.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Tampa Bay area given offshore track on the Atlantic side.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to occasionally moderate outer-band rainfall possible; totals generally below 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rip currents along Florida east-coast beaches, but no significant operational hazard anticipated in Tampa Bay.
